author: Ryan Dube
title: Argentina Seeks Credit Line IMF
text:
BUENOS AIRES—Argentina’s government has begun talks with the International Monetary Fund for a credit line as the administration of President Mauricio Macri seeks to contain a steady depreciation of the local currency.
In a televised address Tuesday, Mr. Macri said he spoke with the fund’s managing director, Christine Largarde, and that she confirmed the IMF would start working on an agreement. Mr. Macri said the aim is to avoid a crisis like those that Argentina suffered in the past. It will be the IMF’s first financial support...
